info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She is an elegant, statuesque woman, and is a sister to [King Paitar](#King-Paitar-Nachiman) of Arafel. She has four Warders. She was sent, along with [Bera](#Bera-Harkin), to establish diplomatic relations with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in the Aiel Waste; upon returning, she followed him to Dumai's Wells and was made to swear fealty to him.

name: Kiyoshi
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) commanded [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) to uphold her as a model sister, and present her with the gift of a new horse. This came right after Elaida found _angreal_ in the rooms of [Josaine](#Josaine) and [Adelorna](#Adelorna-Bastine); the obvious intent was to imply that Kiyoshi helped turn one of them in. It is unknown whether Kiyoshi is Black Ajah, or if she simply was chosen by Alviarin as a convenient person.

name: Kwamesa
chapter: Chapter 23: Next Door to a Weaver
info: Sitter for the Gray Ajah, the youngest Sitter in the Hall in Salidar. She is dark and slender, and has strength in the Power; she is on the same level as [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar).

name: Kyera Termendal
info: Poet and author of a much-disputed translation of the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). She is from Shiote, and wrote between Free Years 700 and 800.

name: Lady Arymilla Marne
info: Brown-eyed Andoran noble with a habit of fainting. She opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. The only real reason [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) kept her around in Caemlyn was to push others into supporting [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin); no one wanted Andor in the hands of Arymilla.

name: Lady Dyelin Taravin
info: Next-in-line to the Lion Throne after [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). She refuses to take the throne without absolute confirmation of the deaths of both of them, despite the feelings of some of Morgase's former supporters. She is Morgase's cousin.

name: Lady Elenia Sarand
info: Shewish, honey-haired Andoran noble with an eye for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Her husband Jarid opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) exiled her from Caemlyn, as Morgase did long ago, for attempting to take the Lion Throne.

name: Lady Naean Arawn
info: A slim, palely beautiful Andoran noble with big, blue eyes and waves of black hair. She sneers a lot. She opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) exiled her from Caemlyn, as Morgase did long ago, for attempting to take the Lion Throne.

name: Lady Shiaine Avarhin
info: Darkfriend who currently works for [Jaichim Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin). She tried to kill [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) when she found him and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in a shed.

name: Laerad
info: Grizzled Water Seeker of the Shaido Aiel.

name: Lamgwin Dorn
info: [Breane](#Breane-Taborwin)'s boyfriend, a hard, bulky man from Caemlyn. He lived as a street thug, but was loyal to his queen. He joined [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) when she left the country.

name: Lanfear
info: One of the Forsaken. Unlike the rest of the Forsaken, she chose her name for herself, which means “Daughter of the Night” in the Old Tongue. She was born Mierin Eronaile, and was strong in the One Power. She worked at the Collam Daan, the primary facility for research into the One Power. Her final discovery there was what she thought was a new source for the One Power, one that could be harnessed by men and women alike—this source turned out to be the emissions through a thin spot in the Pattern from the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison. She and another Aes Sedai named Beidomon bored into the prison, creating what is now referred to as simply the Bore, allowing the Dark One to touch the world again and leading to the War of the Shadow. Around this time, Mierin formed a relationship with [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who headed the forces of the Light against the Shadow and was the most powerful man she had found. Lews Therin broke off the relationship when he found that she only wanted him for his power and authority and the possibility of power for herself through him. Mierin never let go of him, and when he later met and married Ilyena Moerelle, she tried to disrupt the wedding ceremony as well as split the two apart by any means. Eventually she went to Shayol Ghul to dedicate her soul to the Shadow, most likely to finally get back at Lews Therin for leaving her. She declared as her territory the World of Dreams, _Tel'aran'rhiod_, using it to ends now unknown. She transferred her obsessive love intact to Lews Therin's soul's new body, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), after being freed from the Bore. She first appeared to him as a young woman named Selene, but disguised her appearance as a slightly less beautiful (but still stunning) woman. Almost a year later, Lanfear found that Rand had been “unfaithful” to her, and she tried to kill him. Before she could, she was pushed through the twisted stone doorway _ter'angreal_ by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Laren
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Plump-breasted woman with gray streaks in the hair at her temples. She is a servant to [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar). By her marriage knife, she had nine children, three of which are dead (two sons died in duels).

name: Lawtin
chapter: Chapter 37: A Note from the Palace
info: One of the Redarms that accompanies [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).

name: Leane Sharif
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Arad Doman, and has coppery skin. Just as her family members were training her in the seductive ways of Domani women, Leane found that her life would take a different direction: she could channel _saidar_, and would do so with or without teaching. She became an Aes Sedai, a member of the Blue Ajah, and was eventually raised to [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche). During the coup led by [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) and [Alviarin Freidhen](#Alviarin-Freidhen) that deposed Siuan, Leane was thrown in the dungeon and stilled. Leane tried turning to her seductive side to try to replace what she lost in stilling; she was out of practice, but did well enough. She eventually convinced the Aes Sedai in Salidar to let her stay with them and maintain the network of eyes-and-ears she kept in Tar Valon as Keeper. She was later Healed by [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), and restored to some of her former capacity for using the One Power. The Hall of the Tower in Salidar decided that since she had been stilled, she was no longer Aes Sedai for that time and thus all of her titles and choice of Ajah were null and void. Instead of petitioning to re-enter the Blue Ajah, she asked the Green Ajah if it would accept her; it did.

name: Lelaine Akashi
info: Slender Sitter for the Blue Ajah in Salidar. She carries a dignified air about her. She was a Sitter in the White Tower for forty years before [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed.

name: Leral Anan
info: One of [Setalle](#Setalle-Anan)'s daughters. She looks after [Olver](#Olver) when he is around the inn.

name: Lerman
info: Chief mason for [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s palace. He stared in disbelief when Elaida told him her palace was to have a spire ten spans higher than the Tower itself. However, being that it is Elaida he is dealing with, he will have to find a way....

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), Breaker of the World. He was perhaps the greatest man who ever lived, and the most powerful Aes Sedai in recorded history. During the War of the Shadow, he led the forces of the Light against the Forsaken, and led the final stroke which re-sealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) back into his prison. Unfortunately, during this stroke he was driven insane by the Dark One's touch, eventually killing his wife Ilyena, his children, and everyone he loved, as well as anyone who carried a drop of his blood. For this act, people remember him with a new name: [Kinslayer](#Kinslayer). After he had done this, [Ishamael](#Ishamael) gave him his sanity back long enough for him to realize what he had done; Lews Therin killed himself by drawing on _saidin_ too heavily, causing a mountain to form on the spot where he stood. This mountain is called Dragonmount, and is near the present-day city of Tar Valon. It is unfortunate that the name of one of the greatest men to ever live is now synonymous with evil, for Lews Therin killed his family due to the Dark One's influence, but without Lews Therin there may not have been a world left in which to kill them. Lews Therin's voice sometimes speaks inside [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s head, offering advice or sobbing over lost women, but is getting more and more vocal. It even tries to seize control of _saidin_ sometimes, much to Rand's fear.

name: Leyn
info: Wise One. She can channel, and is of moderately high strength.

name: Liah
info: Maiden of the Spear of the Cosaida Sept of the Chareen Aiel with a scar across her face. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) came to Shadar Logoth to set wards on the Waygate there, Liah got separated from the group and was never found. Presuming she was dead, Rand took the group back to Caemlyn. When Rand returned to Shadar Logoth weeks later to fight [Sammael](#Sammael), he discovered that Liah was still alive, if not completely sane anymore. He killed her with balefire when she was attacked by Mashadar.

name: Lian
info: Mother-sister to [Aviendha](#Aviendha), sister-wife to [Amys](#Amys), wife of [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc). She is the roofmistress of Cold Rocks Hold.

name: Liandrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Red. She has light hair and a face like a doll. She grew up in Tarabon. She led the group of thirteen Aes Sedai who declared themselves Black Ajah and fled the White Tower, murdering guards and even sisters in the process. Liandrin was Red Ajah before turning to the Black, but her oath to the Black was sworn before even being raised to the Accepted (perhaps before she came to the Tower), so it can't really be said that she was ever Red Ajah at all.

name: Lini Eltring
info: Childhood nurse to Maighdin, [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) Trakand. She has many wise sayings, which Elayne and Morgase are fond of quoting to themselves and others (probably because they have been ingrained into their minds so much). She went with Morgase when she fled Andor to Amadicia.

name: Lirene Doirellin
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She resigned as a Sitter fifteen years ago and went into “voluntary” retreat. She is now nervous and shifty.

name: Loial
info: Son of Arent son of Halan, an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He left the _stedding_ at around age 90 to see the world; by Ogier standards, he is not yet old enough to leave the _stedding_ without permission from the Council of Elders. He is fond of books and history, and is an excellent Treesinger. He is writing a book about his travels with the three _ta'veren_ he meets, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Loial is constantly afraid that his mother will find him and try to marry him off and settle him down; however, he does like his mother's choice of wives for him, [Erith](#Erith). He, like most of the Ogier, is sad that most humans don't remember the Ogier, and is horrified that some even think he is a Trolloc on first seeing him.

name: Lopin
info: [Nalesean](#Nalesean-Aldiaya)'s round-bellied manservant.

name: Lord Brend
info: Name [Sammael](#Sammael) uses as a member of the Council of Nine in Illian. He rules Illian in truth, if not in name. He refuses to admit that the Forsaken are loose.

name: Lord Captain Canvele
info: A Lord Captain of the Children of the Light.

name: Lord Davram t'Ghaline Bashere
info: Lord of Bashere, Tyr, and Sidonia; Guardian of the Blightborder; Defender of the Heartland; Marshal-General to [Queen Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi) of Saldaea. He is also her uncle, and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s father. He has black eyes, a beak-like nose, and a mustache. He is also slender, and shorter than most men; his wife towers over him. He left Saldaea with an army to hunt down [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) after he escaped, and ended up in Caemlyn when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) defeated [Rahvin](#Rahvin). He now commands Rand's troops in Caemlyn (those that cannot channel and are not under the command of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) or one of the Aiel chiefs). He is feared by any potential opponents in battle; he is one of the best generals alive.

name: Lord Gaebril
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Man who came to Caemlyn just as riots sprang up throughout the city. He joined and led the faction that restored order in the city, and upon [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s return, he gave her her kingdom in one piece, as it was when she left. Allegedly, she was so happy that he had done this that she made Gaebril her new advisor. However, during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s trip through Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter, Mat overheard Gaebril ordering someone to kill Elayne and anyone else with her—he tried to find a way to report this information to Morgase, but ended up telling Elayne. Gaebril was discovered to be [Rahvin](#Rahvin), one of the Forsaken, who has a preference to having pretty women around him. His “pretty woman” is Morgase, and he planned to wrest control of Andor from her. Morgase realized he was controlling her and left the country so quickly a rumor sprang up that she had been killed; when Caemlyn was taken by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and Rahvin killed, the rumor changed to say that Rand had killed Morgase, instead of Gaebril.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
info: Former First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to the position because Morgase had no living male relatives, but was exiled from Caemlyn on a suggestion from Morgase's new advisor, [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He moved to his private estates in rural Andor, where he presided over the trial of three young women who unintentionally burned a barn: they turned out to be [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the former [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat); [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), the former [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), and [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). When these three made an oath to serve him and then apparently broke it, he followed them out of sheer curiosity to Salidar. Once their, he discovered the true identity of the three, as well as that the Tower was truly broken. The Aes Sedai in Salidar persuaded him to command the army they would need to take the Amyrlin Seat from [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), since he was the only commander that the Warders thought would be willing and able to help them. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall), Rodel Ituralde, [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), Agelmar Jagad, and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). Although neither of them would admit it, Bryne seems to be developing feelings for Siuan Sanche; he wishes to avoid another mistake like his relationship as [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s lover, and also never forgave Siuan for when she publicly shamed him years ago. She seems to be developing similar feelings for him, much to her dismay. He plans to be the first ever general to take the city of Tar Valon; the closest anyone else ever came was with [Guaire Amalasan](#Guaire-Amalasan)'s armies, who got as far as the White Tower itself, and [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing), who never managed to go beyond beseiging the city. Actually, Amalasan's troops never beseiged the city, they simply managed to breech the walls; Hawkwing never managed to stop the supply ships coming up the river. Bryne believes he will be able to overcome this problem.

name: Lord Lieutenant Havien Nurelle
info: Lieutenant of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s Winged Guards. Pink cheeked and young.

name: Lord Lir Baryn
info: Andoran lord, a “whip of a man” who always wears a sword. He was one of the nobles who opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Slender and strong. The only reason [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) kept him around was to have everyone support [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin); no one would leave Andor to the likes of Lord Lir.

name: Lord Logain Ablar
info: False [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) who created war in Ghealdan and surrounding nations before being captured and gentled by the Red Ajah. He got loose during the chaos surrounding the deposing of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), and eventually was escorted out of Tar Valon by Siuan and her traveling companions. Before he was gentled he was of considerable strength, and attracted quite a following of loyal soldiers. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) still has viewings of him with a halo over his head, which she thinks indicates that he will become a figure of great power sometime in the future. Recently, Logain has come forward with information that indicates the Red Ajah actually put him up to declaring himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), most likely with the pretext that bringing down a false Dragon would bring more glory than gentling a simple man who could channel. Logain was recently Healed by [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), and was let free by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to do as he pleased; it is assumed that he is on his way to the Black Tower.

name: Lord Luan Norwelyn
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne.

name: Lord Mangore Kiramin
info: Sword-bard of Aramelle and Warder to [Caraighan Maconar](#Caraighan-Maconar). He translated the Prophecies of the Dragon into what was then called the “vulgar tongue” about three hundred years After the Breaking.

name: Lord Pelivar Coelan
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne. He is one of the lords in Andor who arrested [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) for claiming the Lion Throne; he supports [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) as Regent until [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) returns.

name: Lord Semaradrid Maravin
info: Highest-ranking Cairhienin lord that survived the battle. He now commands a part of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s massive army that he plans to send into Illian.

name: Lord of the Grave
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Loya
info: Servant to [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara. [Olver](#Olver) likes her.

name: M'Hael
info: Title given to [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) by his students. It means “leader” in the Old Tongue.

name: Mabriam en Shereed
info: Aes Sedai out of Legend. She negotiated the Compact of the Ten Nations. She was _ta'veren_.

name: Maddin
info: The founder of Altara. His holiday is two days after the Feast of Embers.

name: Madic
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Balding man, one of [Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s servants.

name: Maeric
info: Blocky Shaido spearman. He is _Seia Doon_. He is [Dyrele](#Dyrele)'s husband.

name: Maire
info: One of [Colavaere](#Colavaere-Saighan)'s attendants. She disappeared shortly after telling [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) of what Colavaere revealed to her about her plans. She is presumed dead at Colavaere's hands.

name: Maisia
info: Woman who accompanies [Caddar](#Caddar) to meet with [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She is actually [Graendal](#Graendal). The name seems to mean something derogatory (at least to Graendal) in the Old Tongue.

name: Malin din Toral Breaking Wave
chapter: Chapter 13: The Bowl of the Winds
info: Wavemistress of Clan Somarin and Sailmistress of _Windrunner_.

name: Malindare
info: Maiden of the Spear with very dark hair, darker than any other Aiel. She is rounder than most Maidens.

name: Mandarb
info: [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s black stallion. His name means “Blade” in the Old Tongue.

name: Mandelain
chapter: Chapter 3: Hill of the Golden Dawn
info: One-eyed clan chief of the Daryne Aiel. He is not sure how to take the news of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s dissappearance, and his holding his counsel; he listens to both [Timolan](#Timolan) and [Indirian](#Indirian), though.

name: Manel Rochaid
info: One of the Asha'man.

name: Marigan
info: Identity assumed by [Moghedien](#Moghedien) in order to slip in amongst [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s refugee women in Salidar. None save Nynaeve, [Birgitte](#Birgitte), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Leane](#Leane-Sharif), and [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) know that the necklace she wears is actually an _a'dam_, a device used to control her so she cannot do the things Forsaken usually do.

name: Marin al'Vere
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s mother. She is an important figure in the Women's Circle in Emond's Field; she is used to getting her way with other people.

name: Maringil
info: Cairhienin lord. He had white hair to his shoulders, was blade thin, and icy cool. He was killed by [Colavaere](#Colavaere-Saighan) because he was competition for the Sun Throne.

name: Marith Riven
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She was captured and shielded after the battle at Dumai's Wells. [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) was once punished for throwing a cup at her; [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) relayed that punishment to Seta through the _a'dam_ when they captured her.

name: Martyn Tallanvor
info: Tall young man from Andor. He served in the Queen's Guards until [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) fled Andor. When [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) had the guards swear new oaths to the laws and customs of Andor (instead of to the Queen), Tallanvor swore them but immediately went back to his room and reswore the old oath in the old style (cutting his arm with his sword, indicating that his blood will be shed before the Queen's will). He loves his queen more than his life, and now serves as her personal bodyguard.

name: Masema Dagar
info: The [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He was once one of Uno's underlings, and the one who respected [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) the least, but after he found out that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), he went his own way, preaching of Rand's glory as the “Lord Dragon Reborn.”

name: Mashadar
info: The evil that consumed Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth, during the Trolloc Wars. It can kill simply by making contact with its victims.

name: Mashera Donavelle
info: Aes Sedai of the stories who bore seven children for a man she loathed because of orders from the White Tower.

name: Mashiara
info: _Mashiara_, p. 493 (631)—What [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) calls [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). The term means “my lost love” in the Old Tongue.

name: Master Denal
chapter: Chapter 23: Next Door to a Weaver
info: The man [Derys](#Derys-Nermala) wants to marry.

name: Master Jen
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Short, bullish young man, a servant of [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara.

name: Masuri Sokawa
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She grew up in Arafel. Part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She shares a room with [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey), [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan), and [Faeldrin](#Faeldrin-Harella) in the palace.

name: Matilde
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Skinny woman, one of [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s servants.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attacks after Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence. These gaps were filled and more when he passed through the twisted door to the land of the Eelfinn, where he was granted his three requests: a foxhead medallion that protects him from women's channeling, a way out of the land of the Eelfinn, and the memories of past lifetimes that were the gaps in his memory. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has found that battles are the ultimate form of gambling, and along with his newfound memories he can win almost every battle he fights quite decisively. He has four sisters, including Eldrin and Bodewhin, who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father [Abell](#Abell-Cauthon) is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the World. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. In the Waste, he met a woman named Melindhra, a Maiden of the Spear from the Shaido Clan. However, she is not the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), who Mat is destined to marry according to the Aelfinn; besides, she tried to kill him on orders from her master among the Darkfriends. Mat had to kill her to save his own skin, but regrets it deeply. He has a scar along his neck from where the Eelfinn tried to kill him—which was also in accordance with what the Aelfinn told him, that he is “to die and live again.” He currently heads an army called the Band of the Red Hand, after the army of King Aemon of old Manetheren, and serves in a way as Rand's personal general—this works well, since Mat seems to be a better general than even [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), who has earned his good reputation as one of the best commanders alive. Mat does not trust any Aes Sedai, and because of this refuses to take his foxhead medallion off even to take a bath. Mat is currently in Ebou Dar trying to keep an eye on [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) from getting themselves killed.

name: Maylin
info: Serving girl at The Old Sheep, an inn in Ebou Dar. Her job is essentially to stand outside the shop and attract (male) customers. She is quite pretty, but a little dense.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) who wreaked havoc in Saldaea before being captured by Aes Sedai. He later escaped his captors, possibly with Black Ajah assistance (although this is totally unconfirmed). Hearing of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty, Taim came to Caemlyn and became the head of Rand's school of male channelers. He is almost as strong in the One Power as Rand is. Taim claims to have held off the madness that normally accompanies the taint for almost 35 years—he has been using the One Power for a very long time, and knows many tricks that Rand had not thought of on his own or been taught by [Asmodean](#Asmodean), such as how to test men for the ability. He seems to resent being second to Rand.

name: Megana
chapter: Chapter 3: Hill of the Golden Dawn
info: Wise One who set watches with [Bair](#Bair) for anyone returning to Cairhien.

name: Meira
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She was among those who dismembered [Desaine](#Desaine).

name: Melaine
info: Wise One of the of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and was one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She can channel. She swore she would never love a man, but changed her mind later and married [Bael](#Bael), her clan chief, thus becoming sister-wife to [Dorindha](#Dorindha). She has sun-colored hair and green eyes. She is currently expecting twin daughters.

name: Melore
chapter: Chapter 37: A Note from the Palace
info: Plump Domani woman in her middle years.

name: Mendair
info: One of [Harnan](#Harnan)'s companions.

name: Merana Ambrey
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah who grew up in Caemlyn. Leader of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in Caemlyn.

name: Meri
info: One of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s new handmaids. She has a pinched nose, dark eyes, and black hair. She was chosen by [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin).

name: Merilille Ceandevin
chapter: Chapter 13: The Bowl of the Winds
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Slender and palely elegant, she has glossy black hair and large liquid eyes. She grew up in Cairhien. She was sent to Ebou Dar to convince the queen to support Salidar.

name: Mesaana
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, Mesaana was told she was unfit to do research at the Collam Daan, but was capable of teaching others. She spent her years teaching until the Bore was opened and she dedicated her life to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). During the War of Power, she created “schools” for the children, at which she taught the children to spy on their parents and other such things. After her release from the Bore, Mesaana set herself up in the White Tower, where she could control events without anyone suspecting she was behind them. She has been cooperating with [Semirhage](#Semirhage) to some extent.

name: Metwyn
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms.

name: Micara
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is young and pretty with a delicate mouth and large blue eyes. Although she is the weakest of the Shaido Wise Ones, she was put in charge of holding [Galina](#Galina-Casban)'s shield; Galina believes it to be a way of reminding her that even though she could try to escape, she still should not.

name: Mikel of the Pure Heart
info: Hero of Legend called back by the Horn of Valere.

name: Mili Skane
info: Real name of [Shiaine](#Lady-Shiaine-Avarhin). A saddler's daughter from a village near Whitebridge. She went to Tar Valon at age fifteen to become a novice in the White Tower. When she was told she could not channel a spark, she became a Darkfriend. She is now one of the best assassins around.

name: Miren
info: One of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunts who raised her after her father died.

name: Mistress Carin
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Grim-faced woman short of middle age, a servant of [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara.

name: Mistress of Novices
info: The Aes Sedai who is in charge of training novices in the White Tower. The post was held by [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah until a coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) chased her out of the Tower. The post is now held by Silviana Brehon in Tar Valon and [Tiana Noselle](#Tiana-Noselle) among the Aes Sedai who fled.

name: Mistress of the Ships
chapter: Chapter 13: The Bowl of the Winds
info: The leader of the fleet of Sea Folk ships, similar to a fleet admiral.

name: Modarra
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is as tall as most (Aiel!) men.

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Spider” in the Old Tongue. She always works from safety, attacks from safety, and will run unless she can do so. She developed a command of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ that surpassed even [Lanfear](#Lanfear)'s mastery—in the real world, Lanfear was more powerful, but even she could not top Moghedien in the World of Dreams. After being released from the Bore, Moghedien eventually found herself in Tanchico, in the Palace of the Panarch of Tarabon. While there, she chanced upon [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), who was trying to save the Panarch at the time and take the seal on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison from its hold in the Palace. She and Nynaeve fought in a duel to the last, and Nynaeve managed to better Moghedien, much to the surprise of both of them. She managed to escape Nynaeve's tied off shield, and on their next encounter, this one in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, she ripped [Birgitte](#Birgitte)'s soul out of the World of Dreams after Birgitte almost killed her. On her third encounter with Nynaeve, Nynaeve managed to trap Moghedien with an _a'dam_. Moghedien remained bound by that _a'dam_ in Salidar, disguised as [Marigan](#Marigan), but was recently set free by [Halima](#Halima-Saranov).

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born of a noble House in Cairhien, she is Taringail Damodred's youngest half-sister, and [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s niece. She is considered short among her people, and the Cairhienin are already a short people. When it was discovered that she had the ability to channel inborn, Moiraine went to Tar Valon to become an Aes Sedai. Just before being raised to the shawl, she and her friend [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) witnessed Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). Moiraine and Siuan walked away from each other and did not speak to each other again (at least in public), but both held secret communication with each other and dedicated their lives to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Moiraine found the young man she sought on Winternight in Emond's Field, a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), along with two more _ta'veren_, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and two women with the spark of the Power inborn, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). When Moiraine was shortly raised to the shawl, she met [al'Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned King of Malkier, who was fighting alone against the Shadow in the Blight; she asked Lan to become her Warder, and he accepted. She is very strong in the Power, stronger than almost all living Aes Sedai. In the Stone of Tear, Moiraine confronted and killed the Forsaken [Be'lal](#Be-lal) with balefire, just before he would have killed Rand. Later, after having an inkling of the future events from the testing _ter'angreal_ for the Wise Ones, Moiraine managed to push the Forsaken [Lanfear](#Lanfear) through the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_. Other Aes Sedai consider her a legend, not only for discovering the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) but for defeating two of the Forsaken as well.

name: Moridin
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. His name means “Death” in the Old Tongue; no one deserves the name more. He is fond of using the True Power, the power drawn directly from the [Dark One](#Dark-One); the _saa_ have already appeared in his eyes, yet he still controls his use of the True Power (most thought it impossible to avoid drawing too much of it once the _saa_ appeared).

name: Morvrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is stout, and has graying hair. She is one of the six sisters who controls much of the action in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower.

name: Muradin
info: Man who was to succeed [Suladric](#Suladric) as chief of the Shaido Aiel. He went to Rhuidean at the same time [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) did. Rand saw Muradin while inside the _ter'angreal_; he had gouged his own eyes out, and was rapidly dying inside the columns. He never emerged.

name: Myrelle Berengari
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah with an elliptical face. She is young (she has worn the shawl for about fifteen years), and has four Warders named [Nuhel](#Nuhel-Dromand), [Croi](#Croi-Makin), [Avar](#Avar-Hachami), and most recently [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s old Warder who she is trying to save. She treats all of them as husbands in defiance of all law and custom, inside the Tower and out. She fled the White Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed, along with most of her Ajah. She is one of the six sisters who hold much of the power in Salidar despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. She received [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s bond after [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s death, bringing her Warder count to four, at least until [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) is ready to have him as a Warder. She seems to be the resident expert on saving Warders; three of her four (Nuhel, Avar, and Lan) were previously bonded to other sisters.

name: Nad
info: Man who serves [Falion](#Falion-Bhoda) and [Ispan](#Ispan-Shefar).

name: Nae'blis
info: The one who would stand only a step below the [Dark One](#Dark-One) on the Day of Return, commanding all Darkfriends in the Dark One's name. The position has been promised to [Demandred](#Demandred) if he does well in his duties, as well as [Sammael](#Sammael), but it is likely that _all_ the Chosen were offered the position if they did well.

name: Naeise
info: Maiden of the Spear of the same sept as [Maeric](#Maeric).

name: Nalesean Aldiaya
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s subcommanders in the Band of the Red Hand. He is a blocky man, taller than [Talmanes](#Talmanes-Delovinde). He leads the other half of the Band of the Red Hand's cavalry. He keeps a pointed black beard.

name: Nandera
info: A sinewy Maiden of the Spear with graying blonde hair. She leads the Maidens of the Spear that came to rescue [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Nariene
info: Long-dead queen of Altara, immortalized by a statue in Mol Hara square. She was noted for her honesty, but not enought to have been depicted completely bare-chested in her statue.

name: Nerilea
info: Square-faced Maiden of the Spear.

name: Nerim
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s manservant. He is short even for a Cairhienin, and skinny.

name: Nesta din Reas Two Moons
chapter: Chapter 13: The Bowl of the Winds
info: [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) to the Atha'an Miere. She is used to getting what she wants, with reason.

name: Nesune Bihara
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is one of the Aes Sedai now sworn [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She always listens to all sides before drawing any conclusions, and she remembers _everything_. She is slender, and grew up in Kandor.

name: Nevin
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Man [Beslan](#Beslan-Mitsobar) fought in a duel. Beslan meant to injure his sword-arm, but Nevin slipped and was run through the heart.

name: Niande Moorwyn
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah, former advisor (until his assassination...) to [King Galldrian](#King-Galldrian-su-Riatin-Rie) of Cairhien.

name: Nicola Treehill
info: Slender, black-haired, dark-eyed novice; she is about [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s age. She was a refugee from Ghealdan. She has already developed several Talents, including the ability to see _ta'veren_ and Foretelling, although what she Foretells is usually in such language that only poets can understand it. Her potential exceeds that of all Aes Sedai currently alive, with the exception of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and Nynaeve.

name: Nisao Dachen
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She agreed to assist [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) with helping [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) because of problems she foresaw with his mind. Her specialty as a Yellow sister is psychiatric problems.

name: Norine Dovarna
info: Big-eyed, dreamy Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She thinks that if the [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) is of the White Ajah, then she should be the Keeper of the Chronicles.

name: Norlea
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She was among those who dismembered [Desaine](#Desaine).

name: Nuhel Dromand
info: One of [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari)'s four Warders. He also serves as a husband to her. He is dark-skinned and bulky with a curly beard with a bare upper lip. He is one of the Warders Myrelle saved; his first mistress died.

name: Nynaeve al'Meara
info: A young woman from Emond's Field, now an Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She was the Wisdom of her village, the youngest such ever chosen in Emond's Field. She left when four of her villagers were taken away from the Two Rivers by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). While the group traveled away from her home and toward her new life, Nynaeve made several discoveries: she could channel the One Power, and had already done so without really knowing what she was doing; she developed feelings for al'Lan Mandragoran, Moiraine's Warder and the uncrowned king of the now dead nation Malkier; and she has a major role to play, as all of her younger friends in the group do, in the years to come. She is very strong in the One Power; only a select few who were alive during the Age of Legends could match her. When she arrived in Tar Valon, she was raised Accepted without any tenure as a novice, despite not being able to even _sense_ the True Source unless angry, a result of her having to learn some minimal control of her ability without teaching. She was sent on a false mission by [Liandrin](#Liandrin) on which she was almost leashed by the Seanchan as [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) was. After she returned to the Tower, [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) sent her on a mission to hunt down Liandrin and her fellow Black Sisters; while hunting them in Tanchico, she encountered [Moghedien](#Moghedien) and managed to better her in a duel of the Power. Moghedien escaped, but two encounters later Nynaeve once again managed to get the better of her, leashing her with an _a'dam_ in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Nynaeve took Moghedien with her to seek out [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Rahvin](#Rahvin) while they were fighting each other, and at the last moment before Rahvin might have won, she nearly burned Rahvin to ash with a giant weave of fire that was most of what Moghedien could draw to produce it; the distraction was enough for Rand to regain control of himself and destroy Rahvin with balefire. Nynaeve then kept Moghedien under control with a modified _a'dam_ in Salidar. Nynaeve wished to become Aes Sedai for the sole purpose of Healing; she thinks the Tower meddles in the affairs of nations far too much, and wants no part of it. She is determined to Heal anything short of death, and has already managed to Heal gentling. Nynaeve felt bad when Moiraine died, because her first thought was not of her, but that now Lan was free from their bond. She was not told that Lan's bond had been passed to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) the moment of Moiraine's death.

name: Old Cully
info: Head of the circle of Darkfriends which [Jaichim Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin) is a part of.

name: Olver
info: Boy of nine who sat on the wrong horse and almost had his neck broken for the trouble. He is adopted after a fashion by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and his Band of the Red Hand. His parents were killed when the Shaido ravaged Cairhien.

name: Padan Fain
info: Former peddler that frequently came to Emond's Field. A Darkfriend, he was given orders to locate the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) and narrowed it to three boys in Emond's Field. While persuing them, he encountered the spirit of Mordeth in Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth. Mordeth attempted to consume Fain's soul, but instead the two souls merged, producing something more evil than either of them alone. Fain no longer takes his orders from the Shadow; he has his own evil agenda. It is said, "The look of the Eyeless is fear," from observing that a Myrddraal's look causes fear in the hearts of men. Fain's look has that effect on Myrddraal—Fades feel the same fear of Fain as men feel from a Fade. Fain is also called Ordeith, a name he adopted to become a Whitecloak officer. He is perhaps the most evil man alive. He now serves as advisor to [Toram Riatin](#Toram-Riatin), one of the Cairhienin nobles in rebellion to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Rand has a bounty of 100,000 gold crowns on his head—Fain killed Rand's friends because they were his friends, he pillaged his homeland because it was his homeland, and Rand intends to see him dead for it.

name: Paedrig
info: Hero of Legend called back by the Horn of Valere. He is known as the Golden-tongued Peacemaker.

name: Panarch Farede
info: Panarch of Tarabon near the end of the War of the Hundred Years. She was responsible for promulgating the calendar that now bears her name, which measures years of the New Era (NE), the first of which marked the (arbitrary) end of the War.

name: Pedron Niall
info: Former Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, highest office among the Children. He is one of the great military commanders in the world, in company with [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), Agelmar Jagad, Rodel Ituralde, [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and several Aiel chiefs. He was trying to get Altara and Murandy to cede land to Illian so the Council of Nine wouldn't invade both countries. He also tried to expand Amadicia's borders into parts of Ghealdan. His headquarters is in Amadicia, and he ruled there even above [King Ailron](#King-Ailron), although this was not spoken of openly. Niall recently offered a treaty with [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, offering Whitecloak assistance to retake her throne in exchange for Whitecloak presence in Caemlyn and elsewhere in Andor, a presence that Morgase had not allowed even a fraction of during her reign. Niall was killed by his alleged Spymaster, [Abdel Omerna](#Abdel-Omerna), who claimed he had gone against everything the Children stood for by allowing Morgase to avoid being put to the question. He was replaced by [Eamon Valda](#Eamon-Valda), who also killed Omerna.

name: Peral Torval
info: One of the Asha'man.

name: Perrin Goldeneyes
info: Nickname given to [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) by people in the Two Rivers; they chose it because of his wolf-like eye color.

name: Perrin t'Bashere Aybara
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. When he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) got separated from the rest of the group while fleeing the Trollocs on Winternight, Perrin met a man named Elyas Machera. Elyas, a former Warder who found he could talk to wolves, helped Perrin discover the same ability in himself. Perrin's eyes are now yellow, just like the wolves' eyes, and he can enter what he calls the Wolf Dream (known to most as _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams) with them. Perrin is a childhood friend of fellow _ta'veren_ [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). On the way to Tear, Perrin encountered a young woman by the name of Zarine Bashere, a Hunter for the Horn who took the name of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) (which means “Falcon” in the Old Tongue) as a more appropriate name for a Hunter for the Horn. The two are now married. Perrin is a very large man—he was always a big person, which caused him to be very cautious since he found as a child that he could easily hurt other children if his temper got out of hand. His size helps considerably when helping [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan) on his forge, but sometimes gives others the impression that he is slow and stupid. He returned to the Two Rivers for a time to repel the series of Trolloc attacks; he and his wife are recognized as Lord and Lady there, the first noblility of the Two Rivers since the Trolloc Wars. Perrin was instrumental in freeing Rand from his entrapment at Dumai's Wells; the two had a fight afterwards (they had planned it as a way for Perrin to leave, although they most likely did not plan on it being as violent as it was), and Perrin went to Ghealdan.

name: Pevara Tazanovni
info: Sitter for the Red Ajah. She was friends with [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) as a novice; the two maintained the friendship, although it was a bit restrained due to the constraints that the Red Ajah puts on its members about making friends outside the Ajah. She is short for a Kandori, and quite plump. She has dark eyes. She was once punished for voicing her desire to have a Warder; later, as a Sitter, when she was safer from the wrath of the Ajah, she openly suggested that Warders would make the job of a Red sister much easier. Seaine thinks she would have been happier as a Green. When she was small, many members of her family were killed by Darkfriends; it is for this reason that Seaine confides in her about searching for Darkfriends in the White Tower.

name: Pips
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sturdy brown gelding.

name: Pol
info: [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin)'s handmaid.

name: Pura
info: _Damane_, in service to [High Lady Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath). Her real name is Ryma Galfrey; she was an Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah before being captured.

name: Queen Alliandre Maritha Kigarin
info: Blessed of the Light, Queen of Ghealdan. She is the fourth person to sit on the throne of Ghealdan in the past seven months. She wears jewelry to her meetings with [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) for the sole purpose of giving it to him such that he will not ask for anything more; she also sent a letter to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) offering him her friendship and asking for his help.

name: Queen Isebele
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Queen of Dal Calain, a nation which vanished during the Trolloc Wars. She is said to have made the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) of the day, [Anghara](#Anghara), come to her instead of the other way around.

name: Queen Morgase Trakand
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, High Seat of House Trakand. Mother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She married Taringail Damodred, a prince of Cairhien, to further solidify her claim to the Throne of Andor and keep peace between the two nations; when Tigraine disappeared, Morgase made the best claim to succeed her, and married her widower to gain the support that would be gained by such action. Taringail was Elayne's and Gawyn's father; he died when they were young. Morgase has since gone through several lovers, including [Thomdril Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), a former court-bard; [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), her First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Guards; and most recently [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), a man who led the faction that stilled the riots in Caemlyn that sprang up on Morgase's trip to Tar Valon to inquire about Elayne's whereabouts. Thom was exiled from the city of Caemlyn when he started telling her what he really thought of some of her plans, her relationship with Bryne ebbed away until finally Gaebril told her to exile him too, and Gaebril eventually chased Morgase herself out of the city when she found he was usurping her power. The Daughter-Heir of Andor is traditionally trained by Aes Sedai in the White Tower, and Morgase underwent novice training to keep the tradition alive. She was given the gift of a Great Serpent ring despite not being Accepted, and still wears it on her left hand. She was previously advised by [Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) of the Red Ajah, who is now the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) in Tar Valon. When Morgase discovered that Gaebril meant to usurp her throne, she left, and when she learned that the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) had taken over Caemlyn and none of her former supporters would give her aid, she fled to Amadicia to get help from the only place she thought she could: [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall) and the Children of the Light. She is not aware that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) only wants to give her country back to her, not to mention believes that she is dead. If she made her presence known, she would no doubt have her country back in one piece and all would be well, but as royalty she believes she must work on her own and trust no one. The entire world believes Morgase dead except for a select few, all of which are in Amadicia at the moment. Her sign is three golden keys.

name: Queen Rhiannon
info: Queen of Andor years ago who tried to make demands on the White Tower. She did not exactly get what she wanted....

name: Queen Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi
info: Queen of Saldaea, niece of [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), and cousin of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). She has gone into hiding to avoid dealing with the White Tower.

name: Queen Tylin Quintara Mitsobar
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Altara, Mistress of the Four Winds, Guardian of the Sea of Storms, High Seat of House Mitsobar. Her kingdom is small, and she only rules a portion of it; the rest is governed by nobles who are not necessarily loyal to her. She is the second from her House to sit on the throne—this is the maximum traditionally, and the only House to hold it for four generations fell so fast from power that it could not recover. She is advised by [Merilille Ceandevin](#Merilille-Ceandevin) of the Gray Ajah. She is a widow, and does not plan to marry again, although she is always on the lookout for a lover....

name: Rad al'Dai
chapter: Chapter 3: Hill of the Golden Dawn
info: Young man from the Two Rivers. He carries [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s wolfhead banner.

name: Raefar Kisman
info: One of the Asha'man.

name: Rafela Cindal
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She grew up in Tear. She was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken. He was fond of using Compulsion, and was known for being a ladies' man—he always had a woman on his arm. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence in Caemlyn as [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), and used Compulsion to have [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) not only make him her advisor, but her lover as well. He eventually planned to take over the country directly as the first ever King of Andor—he did his best to weaken support for Morgase, exiling her supporters and befriending those who opposed her, finally chasing her from the country as well. Shortly after news of Morgase's death or at least abdication reached Cairhien, Rahvin was confronted and killed by [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ with a weave of balefire strong enough to burn Rahvin's soul out of the pattern for days, possibly all the way back to his release from the Bore.

name: Rana
info: One of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunts. She convinced Min to say that she had just heard a couple talking when one of her first viewings got her in big trouble; she had seen that a man and a woman were going to get married, but he was already married. When he ran off with her, his wife came to find her and threatened to hurt her.

name: Rand al'Thor
info: A young man from Emond's Field in the Two Rivers, now proclaimed to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He is very tall, with curly red-blond hair. He was raised by Tam al'Thor and his wife Kari (until her death around the time Rand was five) in Emond's Field. His real parents, however, were Janduin, the chief of the Taardad Aiel who brought the four clans across the Dragonwall to punish Laman's Sin, and a Maiden of the Spear named Shaiel, who was actually Tigraine Mantear, the runaway Daughter-Heir of Andor. Tigraine gave birth to Rand on the slopes of Dragonmount, in accordance with prophecy; “born of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the Old.” Rand has a heron branded into each of his palms, which he received from the sword Tam gave him while fighting [Ishamael](#Ishamael). He also has two dragons on his forearms, which he recieved in Rhuidean to designate him as the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_, the Chief of Chiefs of the Aiel. He is not only the Dragon Reborn, but also He Who Comes With the Dawn, the man prophesied to reunite the Aiel, and the [Coramoor](#Coramoor), the one prophesied to bring the Sea Folk out of the Sea. He can channel strongly, more so than any person who ever lived (except the previous user of his soul, [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who was obviously of equal strength), and is also _ta'veren_, the most strongly so since Lews Therin as well. Lews Therin's voice has somehow found a new place inside of Rand's head; he talks to him in a mad voice when Rand least expects it, sometimes offering sound advice or knowledge, sometimes babbling, sometimes even trying to wrest control of _saidin_ from him. Unlike Lews Therin, Rand is accompanied by two other _ta'veren_ during this turing of the Wheel, two men born within days (hours, even) of him named [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), who both grew up in Emond's Field as well. Rand is destined to fall in love with three women (and has): [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Aviendha](#Aviendha). Rand has had success in fighting many of the Forsaken; all to confront him have died or been trapped. He killed [Aginor](#Aginor) at the Eye of the World after the Green Man killed [Balthamel](#Balthamel); he allowed [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) to kill [Be'lal](#Be-lal) in the Stone of Tear, and killed [Ishamael](#Ishamael) in the Stone shortly afterward; in the wagons near the Spine of the World, [Lanfear](#Lanfear) confronted him and was pushed into the land of the Eelfinn by Moiraine; he killed [Rahvin](#Rahvin) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ when he came to the Royal Palace in Caemlyn; and [Asmodean](#Asmodean), his teacher, was killed shorlty after Rahvin met his fate. His prophecies fulfilled grow: he has already been born on the slopes of Dragonmount of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the old, taken the Stone of Tear and drawn _Callandor_, and began conquering “under the forgotten symbol,” that of the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. He is working on having the “spotless tower” break and bend knee to him (several Aes Sedai have sworn fealty to him and only him). He is the salvation of the entire world, and as the prophecy states, he _will_ save the world—and Break it again.

name: Reale
info: One of [Colavaere](#Colavaere-Saighan)'s attendants. She replaced [Maire](#Maire).

name: Reanne Corly
info: Eldest of the Knitting Circle, the ruling group among the women known as the Kin. She has blue eyes, and is quite strong in the One Power; she could match [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar), [Kwamesa](#Kwamesa), or [Kiruna](#Kiruna-Nachiman).

name: Renaile din Calon Blue Star
info: Windfinder to the [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) of the Atha'an Miere.

name: Rhadam Asunawa
info: High Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light. He wants every woman affiliated in any way with the White Tower hanged as of yesterday, every book that mentions Aes Sedai or the White Tower burned, and the very words banned. He would have [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) hanged for her months in the Tower if [Niall](#Pedron-Niall) had let him.

name: Rhiale
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She was among those who dismembered [Desaine](#Desaine).

name: Rhuarc
info: Tall, broad-shouldered, blue-eyed clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. He has gray streaks in his red hair. He has two wives: [Amys](#Amys), a Wise One, and [Lian](#Lian), roofmistress of Cold Rocks Hold. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) put him in charge of Cairhien along with [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron).

name: Riallin
chapter: Chapter 18: As the Plow Breaks the Earth
info: Maiden of the Spear with vivid yellow-red hair and a grin for everything. She is plump for a Maiden.

name: Rianna Andomeran
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the White. She was always a coldly arrogant killer. She has a white streak in her black hair above her left ear.

name: Riselle
info: One of [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s servants. She takes [Olver](#Olver) out to the festival so Tylin can have a chance at [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Romanda Cassin
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah with solid gray hair and a high soprano voice. She is the eldest of the Sitters in the Hall of the Little Tower. She came out of her retirement when news of [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) came to her.

name: Ronde Macura
info: Dark-haired seamstress from Mardecin. She was one of the eyes-and-ears for the Yellow Ajah. [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) once spotted the Yellow Ajah's signal outside her shop, and when she and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) went inside, Ronde drugged them with forkroot tea. She was going to send them off to Tar Valon as per the orders she was given until [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) and [Juilin](#Juilin-Sandar) rescued the two women. Her failure to bring them back met with severe punishment; [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) uses her as a threat to people she has out searching for things.

name: Roshan
info: [Samitsu](#Samitsu-Tamagowa)'s Warder.

name: Rovair
info: Man from [Caraline](#Caraline-Damodred)'s party who gives up his horse so [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) can ride it.

name: Samitsu Tamagowa
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is one of the best Healers alive, at least that do it in the traditional way.

name: Sammael
info: One of the Forsaken. During the War of the Shadow, he was one of the Shadow's greatest military commanders. His name means “Destroyer of Hope” in the Old Tongue. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence on the Council of Nine in Illian as [Lord Brend](#Lord-Brend), and effectively rules the country. He bears a battle scar that he got while fighting [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) during the War of the Shadow. He could have had it Healed, but kept it to remind himself of what Lews Therin had done to him.

name: Sarainya Vostovan
info: One of the Kin. She is from Arafel, and is strikingly handsome.

name: Sareitha Tomares
chapter: Chapter 16: A Touch on the Cheek
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She has worn the shawl only a short time, only about two years. She is in Ebou Dar with [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin). She grew up in Tear, and has brown hair.

name: Sarene Nemdahl
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She has a temper, but she will admit she is wrong if she is. She taught novice classes on “the nature of reality.” Her Warder is Vitalien. She has a secret love of writing poetry—she would die of shame if Vitalien ever discovered that she compares him to a leopard and other graceful, powerful animals in her poems. She was captured and shielded after the battle at Dumai's Wells.

name: Sarin Hoigan
info: [Nisao](#Nisao-Dachen)'s Warder. A bald-headed stump of a man with a thick black beard, he still stands taller than his mistress.

name: Sarinde
chapter: Chapter 18: As the Plow Breaks the Earth
info: Wise One from Red Springs, clan hold of the Codarra. She came to help [Indirian](#Indirian).

name: Seaine Herimon
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in Tar Valon. When the Hall was arguing over who to raise as [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat) years back, it was deadlocked over four candidates who had each worn the shawl about fifty years; the Hall wanted an Amyrlin that was younger than the eighty or more years than were common. Seaine suggested [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), then a young Blue sister that had worn the shawl for ten years; she was eventually raised.

name: Sebban Balwer
info: [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall)'s “dry little stick of a secretary.” He is in reality the Master of Spies for the Children of the Light; his identity is known only to Niall, since a decoy spymaster exists in the form of [Abdel Omerna](#Abdel-Omerna).

name: Sei'cair
chapter: Chapter 3: Hill of the Golden Dawn
info: _Sei'cair_, p. 100 (117)—What [Feraighin](#Feraighin) calls [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). I do not know what it means, though I suspect something along the lines of “Eyes of Gold” (compare to _al'Cair'rahienallen_, “Hill of the Golden Dawn” and _sei'mosiev_, which means “downcast eyes”).

name: Seiera
info: [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s new horse. She is mouse-colored.

name: Selame
info: One of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s new handmaids. She is rail-thin. She was chosen for her by [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi), after [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin) conscripted [Meri](#Meri) into service.

name: Selande Darengil
info: One of the people who uses swords instead of spears in imitation of the Aiel. She is the head of her “society.”

name: Semirhage
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, she was one of the best Healers ever known. She was called to all corners of the world Heal people that others thought beyond help. However, she was sadistic; she exacted a price in the form of pain from her subjects in return for her Healing services. Most thought the pain or anguish she exacted from them was a small price to pay for being alive, but eventually the Hall of Servants found out about her practices and gave her the choice of being severed or bound with the Power, never again to know her “pleasures.” She chose instead to pledge for the [Dark One](#Dark-One), and created one of the most oppressive and pain-filled areas of Shadow control during the entire War of Power. After being freed from the Bore, Semirhage went in service to the Dark One by extracting information from captured Borderlanders and Aes Sedai. She also sent the Trollocs to the Stone of Tear to battle those that [Sammael](#Sammael) sent. She is as tall as most men, and wears black most of the time—perhaps because [Lanfear](#Lanfear) always wore white.

name: Seonid Traighan
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Cairhien. She was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She shares a room with [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey), [Faeldrin](#Faeldrin-Harella), and [Masuri](#Masuri-Sokawa) in the palace.

name: Serancha Colvine
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) and [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) put powdered itchoak in her shift when they were Accepted.

name: Sereille Bagand
info: [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) when [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) was a novice and Accepted. She was raised [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat) the year Seaine was raised Aes Sedai; as Amyrlin, she was fiercer than [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) could be with a sore tooth.

name: Setalle Anan
info: Stately innkeeper of The Wandering Woman, the inn at which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Olver](#Olver) stay at in Ebou Dar. She has hazel eyes, marking her a non-native to Ebou Dar.

name: Sevanna
info: Wise One of the Jumai sept of the Shaido Aiel. She is the widow of the last two chiefs of the Shaido, [Suladric](#Suladric) and [Couladin](#Couladin). She has green eyes. She knows that the easiest way to power for herself is to attach herself to men who already hold power; her newest plan is to marry [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_ against his will by using a binder that [Caddar](#Caddar) gave her.

name: Sevlana Meseau
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She was a legend.

name: Shadowman
info: The equivalent to the boogeyman among children in the World of the Wheel.

name: Shaidar Haran
info: Myrddraal of special abilities who escorts the Chosen (i.e., Forsaken) to the Pit of Doom to converse with the [Dark One](#Dark-One). He is head and shoulders taller than all other Myrddraal, who are the height of an average man and all the same height. His name means “Hand of the Dark” in the Old Tongue; most Myrddraal names come from the Trolloc tongue. He is given special consideration; the ceiling of the entrance to the Pit of Doom does not brush his head as it does everyone else's.

name: Shalon din Togara Morning Tide
info: Windfinder of Clan Shodein.

name: Sheriam Bayanar
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with fiery hair. She was [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower before she fled to Salidar with the rest of her Ajah. She led the group of six sisters that hold most of the influence in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. Her tilted, green eyes can be used to intimidate novices and Aes Sedai alike. She is now the [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Shivan the Hunter
info: Hero of Legend called back by the Horn of Valere. His coming is said to herald the end of an Age. He is [Calian](#Calian)'s twin.

name: Sibella
info: Scrawny, yellow-haired Kinswoman.

name: Sierin Vayu
info: [Amrylin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) years ago, two Amyrlins before [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche). She was raised from the Gray Ajah, but according to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) she had more than a touch of Red in her. She only reigned for about two years, then died abruptly; [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) wonders whether [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) had a hand in her death; the Black Ajah did not.

name: Siuan Sanche
info: Born in Tear to a fisherman, she was sent to the White Tower on the first boat to leave after she discovered she had the ability to channel inborn, according to Tairen law. As a novice, she was good friends with [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred), and was present at Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). After being raised to the shawl, she joined the Blue Ajah to dedicate her life to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and eventually came to lead the Blues' network of eyes-and-ears (i.e., spies) before being raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She was only thirty years old when raised to the Amyrlin Seat, making her the youngest Amyrlin to date. She was also one of the strongest Amyrlins in recent history, and one of the most feared among the rulers of nations. Her blue-eyed stare was feared by all. When her twenty-year connection to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) was discovered, she and her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), were deposed and stilled by a group of sisters loyal to [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan). Siuan hoped to regain some of her previous standing in the new Tower that separated from Elaida—her knowledge of the Blue Ajah spy network is hard to match, and she knows much that she thinks would be of use. In one of her viewings, [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) saw that Siuan would have to remain close by to [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)—if she did not, both of them would die. Siuan did not initially know what she meant, but now realizes that she is growing to love the gray-haired man who leads the Salidar army. She had a Warder named [Alric](#Alric), but he died when she was deposed. After coming to Salidar, [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) discovered how to restore Siuan's ability to channel, at least partially. This resurrected a part of her bond with Alric, but did not bring back her former strength, or her binding by the Oath Rod. She can now lie as well as any child. She now serves as an “advisor” to the new Amyrlin in Salidar, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere), but though she puts on a façade of hating the work, she is actually one of Egwene's foremost agents. The fact that she is Aes Sedai, not to mention one who was stilled and Healed again, makes other sisters tend to be oblivious to this fact.

name: Solain Morgeillin
info: One of the Kin. [Reanne](#Reanne-Corly) sent her to the stash of objects of the Power in the Rahad after [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) asked after it. Following a hunch, [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) followed her out of the blue; he suspected she would lead him to the Bowl of the Winds, and she did.

name: Somara
info: Yellow-haired Maiden of the Spear. She is the tallest of those that make up [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard. She is good friends with [Enaila](#Enaila).

name: Someryn
info: Shaido Wise One, fond of revealing dresses.

name: Sora Grady
info: [Jur](#Jur-Grady)'s wife. She disapproved of her husband's decision to come for the amnesty, but lives with it. She is somehow connected to Jur by a bond that the Asha'man believe is similar to the bond between Warder and Aes Sedai.

name: Sorilea
info: Wise One of Shende Hold, of the Jarra sept of the Chareen Aiel. She has thin, white hair; tight, leathery skin; and green eyes. She can channel, but weakly. She is about a head taller than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She is the strongest-willed of the Wise Ones—even other Wise Ones scurry to do her bidding.

name: Sotarin
chapter: Chapter 3: Hill of the Golden Dawn
info: Wise One who comes to meet the newcomer, [Feraighin](#Feraighin).

name: Spar
info: Beggar and Darkfriend who attacked [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and company in Ebou Dar.

name: Stayer
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s second horse. He is well-shod with white forefeet.

name: Stepper
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s dun stallion.

name: Stormbringer
chapter: Chapter 13: The Bowl of the Winds
info: Person [Birgitte](#Birgitte) swears by that she is not Aes Sedai to the Sea Folk. It may be one of their terms for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Suladric
info: Last true chief of the Shaido Aiel, and [Sevanna](#Sevanna)'s first husband. They were married when Sevanna was only sixteen. After his death, [Muradin](#Muradin) went to Rhuidean to become his successor and failed; [Couladin](#Couladin) then declared himself to be the chief of the Shaido despite being refused permission to enter Rhuidean. Suladric's death set off what may some day be called the Shaido War in Cairhien.

name: Sulin
info: Wiry, white-haired Maiden of the Spear. She led the Maidens who made up [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard, but transferred control of them to [Nandera](#Nandera) when she started meeting her obligation to the _gai'shain_.

name: Sumeko Karistovan
info: One of the Kin. She is a very skilled Healer, and has developed methods of Healing that not even [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) has been able to develop. She is possibly the most skilled female Healer alive outside of the Forsaken.

name: Sun King
info: Man out of a story that [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) remembers when thinking about [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran).

name: Suraile
info: [Maeric](#Maeric)'s eldest daughter. She is a Maiden of the Spear who is thinking of giving up the spear to marry a Stone Dog.

name: Swallow
info: [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s black mare.

name: Tad Kandel
info: Andoran Redarm, very dark for an Andorman.

name: Tai'daishar
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s big, fiery-eyed gelding. His name means “Lord of Glory” in the Old Tongue.

name: Takima
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah for almost nine years. She fled Tar Valon when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed.

name: Talene Minly
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah with golden hair. She is friends with [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon).

name: Talia
info: Woman out of a story that [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) remembers when thinking about [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran).

name: Talmanes Delovinde
info: A Cairhienin military commander, about three years older than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and about a head shorter. His _con_ is three yellow stars on a blue field. His banner is a black fox. He rarely smiles, and reminds Mat of a compressed spring. He commands about half of Mat's cavalry in the Band of the Red Hand, and acts as the leader of the entire Band in Mat's absence.

name: Tamarla
chapter: Chapter 37: A Note from the Palace
info: One of the Kin. She is quite old.

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father. He taught Rand about the Flame and the Void, a trick he uses to concentrate and to win archery competitions; Rand found that it is the way he can gain access to _saidin_. Tam is not actually Rand's biological father; he found Rand as a newborn on the slopes of Dragonmount and took him home with him since Rand's mother was dead. He was at Dragonmount as part of the Aiel War, which he left home to participate in when he was young. He became an officer in the Illianer army, and even achieved Blademaster status, acquiring a heron-mark sword. He married a woman from Caemlyn, Kari, who he met while stationed there. When the Aiel War started, he fought Aiel all the way to Tar Valon and the Battle of the Shining Walls, where he found Rand on the mountain. Tam and Kari raised Rand as their own son. Tam always won the archery competitions (or came in second to [Abell Cauthon](#Abell-Cauthon)), and passed his archery skills on to Rand. He also taught [Aram](#Aram) how to use his sword. Tam had no idea that the child he was raising was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Tamra Ospenya
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) before [Sierin Vayu](#Sierin-Vayu), raised from the Blue Ajah. She was interrogated by [Jarna Malari](#Jarna-Malari), then the head of the Black Ajah, and made to appear to have died in her sleep. Her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) was Gitara Moroso; she was one of only three people present at Gitara's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). This may be the information that Jarna was trying to extract from her; it may also be the reason [Ishamael](#Ishamael) killed Jarna for killing Tamra.

name: Tarna Feir
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) sent her to Salidar to communicate with the Aes Sedai there and report about their camp and their numbers. She has pale yellow hair and blue eyes that could freeze the Sun. She was a wilder, and had her block beaten out of her by [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban).

name: Taval din Chanai Nine Gulls
info: Windfinder of _White Spray_.

name: Tell Lewin
chapter: Chapter 3: Hill of the Golden Dawn
info: Young man from Emond's Field, now one of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s soldiers. A bean-pole of a man with a thick mustache in the Taraboner style. He carries Perrin's Red Eagle banner. He is [Dannil](#Dannil-Lewin)'s brother.

name: Temaile Kinderode
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah. She fled the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin).

name: Tesien Jorhald
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah who got after [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) for befriending outside her Ajah years ago.

name: Teslyn Baradon
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She was a Sitter for the Red for fifteen years until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised and asked her to step down from the Hall. Elaida sent her to Ebou Dar to meet with [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara.

name: The Creator
info: The maker of the Universe, people, places, things, the True Source, everything in existence. An alternative name would be God. After He created the world, the Creator made a prison for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One), the Dark One, His complete opposite in every way, to keep him from influencing the world. The Creator is bent on non-interference—He will not directly influence events in the world, instead using a “Chosen One” or simply tugging at the Pattern of the Age in hopes that what He wants to occur will occur, instead of just making it happen. The Forsaken and most Darkfriends consider Him to be inferior to the Dark One, despite the fact that He imprisoned him.

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. His rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is now alive and fulfilling all of the prophecies set to accompany him.

name: The Empress (of Seanchan)
info: Ruler of Seanchan. She is considered to be a direct descendant of the first emperor of Seanchan, Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin. She presides over the Court of the Nine Moons on the Seanchan continent.

name: The Prophet of the Dragon
info: Title given [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) as the self-appointed bringer of the news of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). He is not necessarily sane anymore, but has gained a very large following.
